name: [Request] Very inexperienced with character building, could use some recommendations
author: Hambone9

posts.author: Hambone9
posts.content:
First, thanks in advance for any replies, I appreciate your time!

I have limited experience with NWN in the first place - I've played through the original campaign and started the first expansion but don't think i've ever progressed further.  I'm only vaguely familiar with 3.5 rules; I know the basic idea of the specialty classes and have virtually no idea the best way to throw them together.

I have a friend who is thinking about picking up the Diamond edition and I'd like to play along with him.  There's a good chance we won't get crazy far (lol) so I'd like something playable 1-40, just in case.  I've looked through a bunch of build in the other forums but they all mention persistent worlds, pvp, high/low magic environments, RP/flavor choices, and so on.  I'd like something optimized just for the stock campaign and expansions.  I don't care all that much about flavor in terms of race/weapon choices, etc, I tend to prefer what'll be the most effective.

Something heavy in either druid, paladin, or monk appeals to me.  Weaponmaster sounds like a fun addition in there with a more melee-heavy build.  I like the idea of a druid and having nice summons early on, and being a strong caster later.  Or a lot of monk levels with a little weaponmaster or fighter thrown in, and maybe something else for buffs?  And I really have no idea what goes well with Paladin.  I don't hate the idea of clerics or sorcs too.  In terms of weapons I'd just like something fun and effective.  I like doing lots of crits (who doesnt), or big damage numbers, or weapons where there's lots of fun options to find throughout the campaigns.

I think my friend is likely to pick a wizard or sorc, and focus on necromancy.  And he's going to kind of lead the action, so it'd be nice to have something to compliment him, clean up the leftovers after he does his thing, and/or keep things off his back.

Even if you could just point to builds that are optimized for the campaign + expansions and not concerned with pvp, persistent modules, flavor/RP choices and the like, it'd be appreciated.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I don't have time right now to give you the in-depth reply you deserve. Probably, somebody else will reply before I come back here tomorrow.

The Official Campaign starts at level 1 and takes you to level 17 or 18. SoU starts at level 1 and takes you to level 15 or so, and HotU follows SoU and takes you to about level 28. For the best experience, play the OC with one build and the expansions with another build.

If you want to, you could follow the OC with Mystery of Twin Summits, which would take you the rest of the way to level 40, and follow HotU with the Sands of Fate which would also take you to level 40. I also highly recommend the Aielund Saga, which will take you from level 1 to level 36. Those three epic campaigns will keep you entertained for quite a while.

posts.author: Hambone9
posts.content: Oh I see.  Then yes, 1 build for the OC is definitely my primary concern, if we get that far I can come back for another build for the rest.  I'd think with a max level of 18 or so I may just want a nearly straight class monk, druid, or pally aside from a tweak maybe?  I'm not sure how these classes best benefit from 1 to a few levels of something else.

posts.author: Hambone9
posts.content: Thanks for the suggestion.  Are there decent magic kamas available through the game or are you stuck with regular or vendor-bought +1 kamas or something when you choose it as a weapon?  The STR build seems more up my alley but I honestly have no idea how they play out differently and which would really be more fun.

posts.author: Hambone9
posts.content: Are there still druid/monk builds that are fun 1-40?  I remember looking at this a few years ago and the monk + dragon shape sounded awesome, but nowadays I see these builds don't get dragon shape until like....30's?  Or even 40.  That definitely doesn't sound ideal.  So are there still fun and viable druid+monk builds playable from level 1?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
For going through the OC you don't need anything fancy, a simple warrior will do and can even be tremendously effective depending on the design and the knowledge of your environment. To make my point, here is a simple barbarian done right by hunearo for the legacy rules OC challenge.

=> original-campaign-2002-revisited-t23546 ... tml#p11276

Or you can lose yourself into the yardstick builds thread and its little brother the yarstick prestige builds, found here.

=> concept-yardstick-builds-t2293896.html#p364

=> yardstick-prestige-builds-t2354372.html#p761

Good luck on your journey,

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Both Mystery of Twin Summits and Sands of Fate are very high-magic environments, so a caster would do well, not even that dragon shape.

Here's a plan (it isn't THE plan until you say it is). In the OC and Mystery of Twin Summits, one of you play the Order of the Wyrm build and the other play this Arcane Archer build. They would make a great team.
Spoiler Resourceful Archer 7 (Rogue 17 / Wizard 1 / Arcane Archer 22) Playable 1 - 40, PvM Abilities: DEX: 18 (34) WIS: 8 CHA: 10 Leveling Guide: 01: Rogue(1): Point Blank Shot 03: Rogue(3): Weapon Focus: Longbow, {Uncanny Dodge I} 05: Rogue(5) 07: Rogue(7) 09: Wizard(1): Blind Fight, {Scribe Scroll} 11: Arcane Archer(2) 13: Arcane Archer(3) 15: Arcane Archer(5): Rapid Shot 17: Rogue(10): Improved Evasion 19: Arcane Archer(8) 21: Rogue(11): Epic Weapon Focus: Longbow 23: Rogue(12) 25: Rogue(13): Defensive Roll 27: Rogue(14): Epic Dodge 29: Arcane Archer(14): Great Dexterity II, (DEX=27) 31: Arcane Archer(16) 33: Arcane Archer(17): Epic Prowess 35: Arcane Archer(19) 37: Rogue(16): Improved Sneak Attack I 39: Arcane Archer(22): Great Dexterity V, Great Dexterity VI, (DEX=33) Hitpoints: 322 Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 20/17/35 BAB: 26 AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 32/35 Alignment Changes: 0 Skills: 02: Disable Trap(1), Lore(1), Open Lock(1), Persuade(1), Search(1), Set Trap(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(1) 04: Disable Trap(1), Lore(1), Open Lock(1), Persuade(1), Search(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(5) 06: Disable Trap(1), Lore(1), Open Lock(1), Persuade(1), Search(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(9) 08: Disable Trap(1), Lore(1), Open Lock(1), Persuade(1), Search(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(13) 10: Lore(1), Spot(2), Save(11) 12: Disable Trap(4), Open Lock(4), Persuade(4), Search(4), Spot(1), Tumble(4), UMD(4), Save(1) 14: Spot(1), Save(11) 16: Spot(1), Save(21) 18: Lore(4), Spot(1), Save(1) 20: Spot(1), Save(11) 22: Lore(4), Spot(1), Save(1) 24: Lore(2), Spot(1), Save(3) 26: Lore(1), Spot(1), Save(4) 28: Lore(4), Spot(1), Save(1) 30: Spot(1), Save(11) 32: Disable Trap(5), Open Lock(5), Search(5), Spot(1), Tumble(5), UMD(5) 34: Spot(1), Save(6) 36: Spot(1), Save(16) 38: Lore(5), Spot(1) 40: Disable Trap(3), Lore(1), Open Lock(3), Search(3), Spot(1)

posts.author: Shazz
posts.content: Just quick question about Dragon Warrior 4 (Fighter 18 / Bard 7 / Red Dragon Disciple 15), i know he's designed for Sands of Fate but would i have much trouble in playing him thru OC and Mystery of Twin Summits.

posts.author: Shazz
posts.content:
Thanks for answering and sorry for trouble.
Another probably stupid question: I don't care about Lore and RDD only need 8 points so i can distribute 20 points somewhere else without messing up this build right?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: True, but I didn't see any skill more useful (or less useless) than Lore to put those 20 points.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: One possibility is "persuade" since bards have it as a class skill and modules frequently check it out for various reasons.
